semantic_matches.short_definition: vamanavyāpat in mūtrāghāta , gulma , udara , asHTElA, svaropaghAta
semantic_matches.long_definition: the disorder is characterized by gulmaḥ [palpable glandular enlargment in abdomen/ abdominal lump], udara [udara], asḥṭīlā [aṣṭhīlā/ hypertrophy of prostate gland], svarōpaghāta [supression of voice], tīvrataraśūlaprādurbhāvaḥ [colic pain of acute nature]
semantic_matches.text: NAMC_CODE: SG-3.13 ||| NAMC_term: MUTRAGHATAPLIHAGULMODARASHTHILASVAROPAGHATARTANAM VAMANAVYAPADAH ||| NAMC _term_diacritical: mūtrāghātaplīhagulmōdarāṣṭhīlāsvarōpaghātārtānāṁ vamanavyāpadaḥ ||| NAMC _term_DEVANAGARI: मूत्राघातप्लीहगुल्मोदराष्ठीलास्वरोपघातार्तानां वमनव्यापदः ||| short_definition: vamanavyāpat in mūtrāghāta , gulma , udara , asHTElA, svaropaghAta ||| long_definition: the disorder is characterized by gulmaḥ [palpable glandular enlargment in abdomen/ abdominal lump], udara [udara], asḥṭīlā [aṣṭhīlā/ hypertrophy of prostate gland], svarōpaghāta [supression of voice], tīvrataraśūlaprādurbhāvaḥ [colic pain of acute nature]

semantic_matches.long_definition: the disorder is characterized by sañcchādyatē śvētanibhēna sarvaṁ asitamaṇḍalam/kr̥ṣṇaṁ śuklarūpatāṁ nīyatē [whitish opacity], akṣikōpasamutthitaḥ [inflammation of eyes], tīvrarujā/atitīvrarujā [extremely painful], dhavalābhra upaliptābham [appearance as if covered with white clouds], niṣpāvārdhadalākr̥tiḥ [having shape similar to one half of niṣpāva], atitīvrarāgaḥ [excessive redness], atitīvradāhaḥ [severe burning sensation], atitīvraśvayathuḥ [excessive swelling]
semantic_matches.text: NAMC_CODE: HE-3 ||| NAMC_term: PAKATYAYAH/SIRASANGAH ||| NAMC _term_diacritical: pākātyayaḥ/sirāsaṅgaḥ ||| NAMC _term_DEVANAGARI: पाकात्ययः/सिरासङ्गः ||| short_definition: severe keratitis with hypopyon ||| long_definition: the disorder is characterized by sañcchādyatē śvētanibhēna sarvaṁ asitamaṇḍalam/kr̥ṣṇaṁ śuklarūpatāṁ nīyatē [whitish opacity], akṣikōpasamutthitaḥ [inflammation of eyes], tīvrarujā/atitīvrarujā [extremely painful], dhavalābhra upaliptābham [appearance as if covered with white clouds], niṣpāvārdhadalākr̥tiḥ [having shape similar to one half of niṣpāva], atitīvrarāgaḥ [excessive redness], atitīvradāhaḥ [severe burning sensation], atitīvraśvayathuḥ [excessive swelling]

semantic_matches.long_definition: the disorder is characterized by atisārō jvarō hikkā chardiḥ śūnāṇḍamēḍhratā [afflicted with diarrhoea, pyrexia, hiccup, vomiting, scrotal oedema], jvaraccharditr̥ṣṇātīsāraśōphinam [afflicted with pyrexia, vomiting, thirst, diarrhoea, oedema], yasya mūtraṁ purīṣaṁ ca grathitaṁ sampravartatē| nirūṣmaṇō jaṭhariṇaḥ śvasanō na sa jīvati| [one who is having diminution of agni and passes hard stools, urine will not survive]
semantic_matches.text: NAMC_CODE: EA-4.8 ||| NAMC_term: SVASA-ARISHTAH ||| NAMC _term_diacritical: śvāsa-ariṣṭaḥ ||| NAMC _term_DEVANAGARI: श्वास-अरिष्टः ||| short_definition: fatal signs of śvāsa ||| long_definition: the disorder is characterized by atisārō jvarō hikkā chardiḥ śūnāṇḍamēḍhratā [afflicted with diarrhoea, pyrexia, hiccup, vomiting, scrotal oedema], jvaraccharditr̥ṣṇātīsāraśōphinam [afflicted with pyrexia, vomiting, thirst, diarrhoea, oedema], yasya mūtraṁ purīṣaṁ ca grathitaṁ sampravartatē| nirūṣmaṇō jaṭhariṇaḥ śvasanō na sa jīvati| [one who is having diminution of agni and passes hard stools, urine will not survive]

semantic_matches.long_definition: the disorder is characterized by pūyarudhirāvakīrṇamāṁsakōthaḥ [purtrifaction of muscle associated with pus and blood], jalapraklinnāyāṁ bhūmāviva kr̥mayaḥ saṁjāyantē [like, worms are generated in moist soil], kr̥mibhiḥ pārśvatō gudadāraṇam/ kr̥mayaḥ paritō gudaṁ khādantī [microorganisms damaging soft tissue of anal region], kr̥mikr̥tairmārgaiḥ vātamūtrapurīṣarētāṁsi abhinissaranti [gases,urine,stool,semen are passed through the tracts created by micro organisms.]
semantic_matches.text: NAMC_CODE: ED-16.9 ||| NAMC_term: UNMARGAGAMI-BAGANDARAH/SALYAJANYA-BAGANDARAH/KSHATAJA-BAGANDARAH ||| NAMC _term_diacritical: unmārgagāmī-bhagandaraḥ/śalyajanya-bhagandaraḥ/kṣataja-bhagandaraḥ ||| NAMC _term_DEVANAGARI: उन्मार्गगामी-भगन्दरः/शल्यजन्य-भगन्दरः/क्षतज-भगन्दरः ||| short_definition: bhagandara due to trauma ||| long_definition: the disorder is characterized by pūyarudhirāvakīrṇamāṁsakōthaḥ [purtrifaction of muscle associated with pus and blood], jalapraklinnāyāṁ bhūmāviva kr̥mayaḥ saṁjāyantē [like, worms are generated in moist soil], kr̥mibhiḥ pārśvatō gudadāraṇam/ kr̥mayaḥ paritō gudaṁ khādantī [microorganisms damaging soft tissue of anal region], kr̥mikr̥tairmārgaiḥ vātamūtrapurīṣarētāṁsi abhinissaranti [gases,urine,stool,semen are passed through the tracts created by micro organisms.]

semantic_matches.long_definition: the disorder is characterized by pīnasam [cold, catarrh], ghurghurakam/kaṇṭhaghurghurikānvitaḥ [making ghurghur sound], atīva-tīvravēgaṁ śvāsaḥ/tīvravēgaṁ śvāsam [severe increased respiratory rate/tachypnea], prāṇaprapīḍakam/prāṇōpatāpinam [life threatening], ativēgāt pratāmyati/pratāmyēt tasya vēgēna/tamakapīḍitaḥ [fainting due to tachypnea], kāsatē/sakāsaḥ/kāsam [cough], sannirudhyatē [motionless], kāsamānaśca pramōhaṁ muhurmuhuḥ gacchati [frequent fainting while coughing], ślēṣmaṇi amucyamānē tu bhr̥śaṁ bhavati duḥkhitaḥ [distressed as unable to spit out phlegm], saśāmyati kaphē hīnē [feels better with little spitting of phlegm], tasyaiva ca (ślēṣmaṇi) vimōkṣāntē muhūrtaṁ labhatē sukham / niṣṭhyūtāntē kṣaṇaṁ sukhī [feels better for a while due to spitting of phlegm], kaṇṭhaḥ uddhvaṁsatē [inflammation of throat (pharynx, larynx)], kr̥cchrācchaknōti bhāṣitum [hardly able to speak], nidrāṁ na labhatē [loss of sleep/insomnia], śayānaḥ śvāsapīḍitaḥ/kr̥cchrāt śayānaḥ śvasiti [difficulty in sleeping position/unable to sleep], pārśvē avagr̥hṇāti [hindering in respiration by sides of chest due to vāta], āsīnō labhatē saukhyam / niṣaṇṇaḥ svāsthyamr̥cchati [feels comfortable in sitting posture], uṣṇaṁ caiva abhinandati / uṣṇaṁ kāṅkṣati [desire for hot], ucchritākṣaḥ [bulging of eyes], lalāṭēna svidyataḥ [sweating on forehead], bhr̥śam artimān [sudden onset of pain], viśuṣkāsyaḥ [dryness of mouth], muhuḥ śvāsō muhuścaiva avadhamyatē [body moves along with respiration during attack.], mēghāmbuśītaprāgvātaiḥ ślēṣmalaiśca abhivardhatē/vivarddhatē [aggravation of attack due to clouds, rain, cold, wind coming from front and others which increase kapha], tr̥ṭ-prāyaḥ/tr̥ṣyatē/tr̥ṣam [thirst], svēda-prāyaḥ [perspiration], vamathu-prāyaḥ [vomiting], viśēṣāt durdinē tāmyēt [more distressed on bad weather day], ghōṣēṇa mahatā āviṣṭaḥ [associated with large sound], sakaphaḥ [with sputum/phlegm], annadviṭ [person having aversion towards food], aruciḥ [tastelessness], suptaḥ [numbness], svapataśca vivardhatē [increased on sleep], mōham [confusion/delirium], savēpathuḥ [tremor]
